meanings.definition: The presence of alternative forms of a gene at a specific locus on a chromosome.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study allelisms to understand how genes can vary.
meanings.sent2: The allelisms in the DNA of the twins were different, leading to distinct traits.
meanings.sent3: The allelisms at play in the genetic code made for an interesting research project.

meanings.definition: The study of genetic variations in a population.
meanings.sent1: Allelisms help scientists understand the diversity within a population.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use allelisms to analyze the genetic makeup of different groups.
meanings.sent3: Studying allelisms in various communities can reveal interesting patterns.
